titleStmt.title: Certaine observations of both houses of Parliament. Concerning two letters, the one from the Lord Digby, to the Queenes Maiesty, the other from Mr. Thomas Eliot, at York, to the Lord Digby in Holland. Also a note of such armes, as were sent for by his Maiesty, out of Amsterdam, under his owne hand. Together with diverse passages of the Marquesse Harford, and M. Strowd, at the general assises in the county of Somerset.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Elliot, Thomas.
Bristol, George Digby, Earl of, 1612-1677.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

A note of the armes sent for by the King from Amsterdam -- Observations upon the ensuing letters -- Mr. Elliots letter to the Lord Digby -- The Lord Digbies letter to the Queenes Majesty -- The newes out of Somerset-shire.
